channel.title: Need help coding a 639 server
channel.description: Okay si u cant find any tutorials i just need sommone to point me in the right direction of like where to change all the names on thing like when u log in it says Welcome to ----- that kind of stuff and how to change name of Bank of ---- to bank of myservername if anyone will help itd be apreciated and if you know a tutorial please post the link!(: thx

item.title: Need help coding a 639 server
item.dc:creator: @Lotek1 Lotek™
item.description:
@Lotek1 wrote:

How did you not understand that? Which part of it didn’t you understand?

All i’m saying is, Use the search bar when you open the folder, top right hand corner & search for the name of the base you’re using. It’s simple, if it doesn’t find anything when you search, the files are hidden, then you will have to do the following:

[quote author=Lotek™]

If they’re hidden:

Open Folder --> Top Left hand corner --> Organize --> Folder & Search Options --> View --> Make sure:“Show hidden files,folders,and drives” box is checked.

Then search for the name of the server/base you’re using and change it to yours.

*Only do this if nothing comes up when you search for the base name to change it too your server name.
[/quote

Read full topic

item.title: Need help coding a 639 server
item.dc:creator: @Blast0Scape Blast0Scape
item.description:
@Blast0Scape wrote:

i dont really understand what u mean, i know where my server files are, i just dont know what file it is to change like for 317 it was client.java i dont know where to change all the code at for a 637/639

[quote=“Lotek™, post:2, topic:432283”]Why don’t you just use the ‘Search Bar’ when you open the folder containing the server files?

If they’re hidden:

Organize --> Folder & Search Options --> View --> Show hidden files,folders,and drives

Then search for the name of the server/base you’re using and change it too yours.

Hope this helped.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Need help coding a 639 server
item.dc:creator: @Lotek1 Lotek™
item.description:
@Lotek1 wrote:

Why don’t you just use the ‘Search Bar’ when you open the folder containing the server files?

If they’re hidden:

Organize --> Folder & Search Options --> View --> Show hidden files,folders,and drives

Then search for the name of the server/base you’re using and change it too yours.

Hope this helped.
